abstract.p: Sam Hitt letter responds to July 3 front-page article; contends proposal to downgrade protection for endangered gray wolf is politically driven and is unwarranted (M)

block.p: The proposal to downgrade protection for the endangered gray wolf (''Rules Shielding the Gray Wolf May Soon Ease,'' front page, July 3) is politically driven and biologically unwarranted. It means wolves can be legally shot on sight by ranchers and the recovery process taken away from federal biologists.

We can't afford to declare victory when wolves occupy only 5 percent of their former range. At a minimum, wolves must be free to roam in suitable ecosystems like the southern Rockies before removing federal oversight.

The proposal to downgrade protection for the endangered gray wolf (''Rules Shielding the Gray Wolf May Soon Ease,'' front page, July 3) is politically driven and biologically unwarranted. It means wolves can be legally shot on sight by ranchers and the recovery process taken away from federal biologists.

We can't afford to declare victory when wolves occupy only 5 percent of their former range. At a minimum, wolves must be free to roam in suitable ecosystems like the southern Rockies before removing federal oversight.

Most Americans understand the unimpeachable right of wolves to exist and are eager to practice coexistence. Federal officials should be listening to this majority voice and not buckle under to special-interest pressure.
SAM HITT Founder, Forest Guardians Santa Fe, N.M., July 3, 2000
